com.kirelcodes.miniaturepets.mob

Class Mob

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kirelcodes.miniaturepets.mob.Mob
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Pet

    public class Mob
extends Object
    This is a mob class it is the base class for every mob created with MiniaturePets

      • Mob

        public Mob(@NonNull
           @NonNull org.bukkit.Location loc,
           @NonNull
           @NonNull StructureDataContainer data,
           @NonNull
           @NonNull org.bukkit.entity.EntityType type,
           MobHolder mobHolder)
        Use this method to create a new mob
        Parameters:
        loc - Where the mob should spawn
        data - The model data of the mob
        type - The type of base entity (what entity will be the anchor)

        Parameters:

        container - The mob container

      • teleport

        public void teleport(org.bukkit.Location destination)
        Safely teleport mob to specified target destination, taking into consideration implementation specific issues.
        Parameters:
        destination - specified target destination

      • getBodyParts

        public List<Integer> getBodyParts()
        Use this to get all the entity ids of the mob body parts
        Returns:
        A list of ids of every single body part of the mob (anchor mob + armor stands)

      • getPathManager

        public PathManager getPathManager()
        This will return the path manager of the mob , aka as the brian behind the mob
        Returns:
        The path manager of the mob

      • hasCustomName

        public boolean hasCustomName()
        Returns:
        If the mob has a custom name will return true

      • hasTargetLocation

        public boolean hasTargetLocation()
        Returns:
        Does the mob have any target location to go to

      • removeCustomName

        public void removeCustomName()
        Removes the custom name of the mob

      • setCustomName

        public void setCustomName(String name)
        Sets the custom name of the mob
        Parameters:
        name - Custom name (Please note this method will not translate the symbol \\& to color codes)

      • getCustomName

        public String getCustomName()
        Will return the custom name of the mob
        Returns:
        If the mob has a custom name it will return it, if not it will return ""

      • getNameLocation

        public ArmorStandContainer getNameLocation()
        Using this method you can get the area at which the mob name will appear (unless the anchor mob is visible) It will find out if there is a structure named "head" if not it will search for the highest one
        Returns:
        The armorstand that the name will placed on

      • getTargetLocation

        public org.bukkit.Location getTargetLocation()
        Returns:
        The target location of the mob (where it needs to go)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • onTargetLocation

        public boolean onTargetLocation()
        This method will check if the mob is in the target location , if it is it will set the target location to null (So this is a 1 time use method)
        Returns:
        Is the mob on the target location
